fields.description:
There are cases where a feature-branch, which is related to the ticket, has two or more pull-request open (e.g. to staging and master branch). For that it would make sense to show the target branch for each pull-request listed on the pull-request-dialog box, so the user knows where exactly the link will bring him to.

A *not working* solution for this is to name the pull request itself like "master: ...". As it can be easily forgotten, so its not consistent for a stable workflow.

fields.description:
h3. *Issue Summary*

When a user switch between tabs in Firefox on linux using the {{Alt +1}} to {{Alt + 9}} and you have an Agile board open, instead of switching the browser tabs, JIRA overwrites this behavior registering the event as if you only pressed the number for example, if you press {{Alt + 1}} JIRA registers this as just 1 and this would trigger the shortcut to access backlog.

h3. *Steps to reproduce*
# Open JIRA in a Firefox browser.
# Access an Agile project.
# Press the switch tab controls as described {{Alt + 1-9}}

h3. *Expected Behavior*
JIRA would switch to a new tab as was expected.

h3.*Actual Behavior*
JIRA overwrites the expected browser behavior and instead notices just the number keys hence triggering JIRA's own shortcuts instead.
fields.summary: JIRA overrides browser shortcuts when user is on an Agile Board

h3. Problem Definition

Currently there is no validation check before a node restoring an Indexsnapshot from other node. If there is a node with a bad index it is possible that that node will spread the bad index to others.

A node should be able to validate its index state before replicating to other nodes.

fields.description:
I've found a number of JIRAs about the Issue Detail View. I think some of the frustration I read in the comments on them is because people are experiencing what we are experiencing and the request to address this is getting confused with other issues with the Issue Detail View. 

We don't use/need Issue Detail View. When we click on a card, we want to see the View Issue screen. As is today, clicking on the card or link on card, goes to Issue Detail View. Then we have to click on link there to get to View Issue screen. This is an extra step that we have to do hundreds of times a day. 

The current board option "Hide detail view / Show detail view" *+opens and closes+* the Issue Detail View side panel, but it doesn't *+turn on and off+* the Issue Detail View. Enable it to be turned off so people who don't use it don't have to hop through it to get to the Issue View they do use. The ability to get to the View Issue screen with ctrl+click in another tab doesn't help because it's still another step to the View Issue screen. 

From clicking on issues from filter results, we're trained to expect issue keys to take us to the View Issue screen. We want that behavior to be consistent every time we click on an issue key. If someone doesn't like/use the Issue Detail View, getting sent there is very annoying.  

(on) *What if clicking on the card, opens Issue Detail View, and clicking on the issue key, as it does everywhere else, opens the View Issue screen.*
* Good GUI uses consistent behavior
* The issue keys, as they do across Atlassian products, go to the View Issue screen
* The card, as a feature of Agile Boards, goes to the Issue Detail View, a view which also is a feature of Agile Boards
fields.summary: On boards, have ability to choose: open View Issue screen, not Issue Detail View, from card link

fields.description:
Our organization uses JIRA as a cross-functional task management tool and as a result, some project delivery teams have a coordinated release cadence whereas others are on their own schedules.  The coordinated release teams would like to streamline the usage and filter results of fix versions, but we often find they get "creative" with fix version naming (even when it's an option in the dropdown already since the field can be free-form text).

-Is there a way to make the Fixed Version field a single-select dropdown with administrator-set selections in the drop-down?

-Is there a way to apply this change ONLY to some teams and not for others in JIRA?  E.g. is there a way to use a Project Category field. 

-Is there any anticipated impact of this change on filters/dashboard capabilities? 

Thanks!
val
fields.summary: changing fix version fields to preset, single select dropdowns for certain projects in JIRA (not a global change)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Moving issue using "edit issue" from the backlog to active sprint will cause the issue to be place in a random location 

h3. Environment

* JIRA Version: 7.2.0-OD-03-014
* JIRA Agile - 7.2.2-D20160229T170744
* Chrome: Version 49.0.2623.87 (64-bit)


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Navigate to Scrum board > Backlog tab
# Select an issue that is located in the backlog 
# Edit issue (using shortcut key "e") > Type in the name of an active sprint
# Update issue > Sprint scope will be affected by this action > Confirm
# Issue is added to active sprint, however it position in a random location on the active sprint. 

h3. Expected Results

Issue added to active sprint should be added to bottom to keep Rank integrity of the board. This also allow for easier sorting and rank assignment by the end user.

h3. Actual Results

* Issue is sent to the middle (random location) of the active sprint after using the edit function on a board

Behavior does not occur when you right click on issue and use "send to" an active sprint. Issue is added to the bottom of the active sprint.

h3.Workaround

* Right click and sent to the active sprint
* Drag issue from backlog into active sprint
* Edit issue and then move the appropriate place
fields.summary: Editing issue and assigning to active sprint (using edit) will not place issue at the bottom of active sprint

My team tries to use Jira Agile as exclusively as possible - one consistent UI and all of that. I suppose it would be ideal for the filter to work on components, labels, etc.  But, adding only Description and Comments would be sublime.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Velocity Chart adds to the next sprints commitments, estimates for issues that have been transitioned to statuses that are not mapped to the board  .

h3. Environment (in which this was reproduced)
JIRA 6.4.12
JIRA Agile 6.7.12

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new project and board
# Go to the column configuration and create a new status Eg:Duplicate, but do not map it to any column. *Make sure the status is in "In Progress" category and not "done" category*
# Add issues with story point to the sprint. Note down the story point.
# Move all of them to done status. Complete the sprint and go and note the story point value in Sprint Report and the commitment in the Velocity chart.
# Now create a new sprint. Add two issues Eg: 2 issues with 5 story points each. 
# Move one to done. Open the other issue in the issue screen and transition it to duplicate. Then complete the sprint and note down again the sprint report and velocity chart.
# Create a new sprint, and add two issues. Eg: 2 issues with 5 story points each.
# Complete the current active sprint. Therefore, the *Duplicate* issue will be moved to the above new sprint.
# Start the new sprint and repeat step 6.
# Complete the sprint and check reports. 

h3. Expected Results
The velocity chart should not bring this forward to the next sprint as the issue is in a status that is not mapped on the board

h3. Actual Results
Now, the Sprint Report does only take two issues which are manually added to the sprint into account, ignore the one moved from the previous sprint. However, Velocity Chart does count all of 3 issues.
fields.summary: Velocity Chart adds to the next sprints commitments, estimates for issues that have been transitioned to statuses that are not mapped to the board

fields.description:
I know this has been raised in other tickets, but they seem to refer to server installs, not Cloud.

I have a board showing sub-tasks in swimlanes by their story.  Story is "Team A" or "Team B".  I want to be able to make a quick-filter to show only Stories (and their sub-tasks) for Team A or B, however if I use 
{{"Assigned Team" = "Team A"}}
then the sub-tasks don't show as they don't have "Assigned Team".  If I try something like
{{"Assigned Team" = "Team A" or issuetype in subTaskIssueTypes()}}
then all stories (Team A or B) with any subtasks show up as swimlanes, when I only want to see the stories with Team A (and their subtasks) 

If sub-queries are a no-go for some reason in Cloud, then please propose how this can be done
I want to really do something like
{{"Assigned Team" = "Team A" or (issuetype in subTaskIssueTypes() AND "parent.Assigned Team" = "Team A")}}
or
{{"Assigned Team" = "Team A" or (issuetype in subTaskIssueTypes() AND parent("Assigned Team") = "Team A")}}

For now we've added a post-function on sub-task Create Transition to set the sub-task Team value from the parent, but if the parent Team is changed, then the sub-tasks don't get updated.  

This sub-query, or parent-attribute capability is essential to make these boards useful for our teams.

I suspect a similar ability to refer to the attributes of an issue's Epic-link would also be of value (again, sub-query or other more limited approach).
fields.summary: ability to refer to attributes of sub-task Parent (JIRA-Cloud)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Double byte characters get garbled when searching Confluence page to link to a Sprint if JIRA Software is running on Windows environment.

h3. Environment
* The problem happens if JIRA Software is running on Windows environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA Software 7.1.1 on Windows environment
# Install Confluence 5.9.6 (OS doesn't matter)
# Create an Application Link between them
# Create a Board in JIRA Software
# Create a Sprint in the Board
# Go to *Backlog* and click *Linked pages*
# Click *Link page* and search Confluence pages having title with double byte characters
# The search result is shown, however, the title is garbled (this is the problem)

h3. Expected Results
# The search result is shown properly

h3. Actual Results
# The search result is shown, however, the title is garbled. 
 
h3. Notes
JIRA Software searches Confluence pages by /rest/searchv3/\{version\}/search. The return value is in UTF-8. So I guess it is JIRA Software's bug (not Confluence's)

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround found at the moment
fields.summary: Double byte characters get garbled when searching Confluence page to link to a Sprint

* Create new sprint

fields.description:
This suggestion is related to the limited Smart Commits available between Svn/Git, Fisheye, and JIRA.  Although Smart Commits can edit the workflow status, comments, and time spent on Issues- they cannot edit other fields within an Issue.  Editing other fields is often required when changing an Issue's workflow status, such as assigning a Fix Version or Tester to the Issue.

My suggestion is to allow special commands/syntax to be placed into an Issue's comment and affect some change onto that Issue (like clicking Edit and manually changing fields).  This way, the Smart Commit "#comment" could be used to place a command such as "#assignfixversion-amq5.1.4" into the JIRA comment.  JIRA would then see this and edit the Issue assigning the Fix Version as AMQ5.1.4.  Other possibilities could be #rename, #changeassignee, #changecomponent, etc.

Smart Commits save some time but not when you still have to go into JIRA and update certain Issue fields manually during the development process.  If JIRA could execute commands straight from it's Issue Comments- we could get around the limited scope of the Smart Commits by using them to input those commands to the Comment.
fields.summary: Ability to edit JIRA Issue Fields through Comments (smart commits)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-13334].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
On the [Cumulative Flow Diagram | https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Viewing+the+Cumulative+Flow+Diagram] adding quick filters, Columns, and Swimlanes extends the overall length of the *Refine Reports* report filter drop down modal and will push the apply and cancel buttons beyond the window, with no option to scroll down.  

h3. Environment
* JIRA v7.2.0-OD-03-012
* JIRA Agile v7.2.2-D20160229T170744
* Chrome Version 48.0.2564.116 (64-bit)
* Firefox Version 44.0.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create multiple [quick filters | https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Configuring+Quick+Filters], [Columns | https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-user-s-guide/jira-agile-tutorials/tutorial-adding-a-column-to-a-board], and [Swimlanes | https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-user-s-guide/configuring-a-board/configuring-swimlanes] in the board configuration
# on [Cumulative Flow Diagram | https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Viewing+the+Cumulative+Flow+Diagram] 
# Select Refine Report dropdown

h3. Expected Results
Ability to scroll if the options exceed the available Space

h3. Actual Results
The *apply* and *Cancel* buttons are cut off along with any options that extend below the window:
!Screen Shot 2016-03-08 at 10.11.02 AM.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes
This impacts users with smaller screens and Lower resolution settings the most, but also impacts anyone with complex boards using many columns, with multiple swimlanes and then use many quick filters to better organize the complex board.


h3.Workaround
Zoom out in the browser until the apply option is visible and can be selected, or press *esc* to close the dialouge to cancel any setting changes
fields.summary: Refine Filters Modal dialog hides buttons on Cumulative Flow report

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a sprint is closed but it still have open issues, then the issues go back to backlog (or a new sprint). If an user tries editing the sprint field on one of these issues, he has the option to add a new value but he can't remove the closed sprint. When the sprint field is edited through 'Bulk Operation' (Edit or Move), the closed sprint is *removed* from the field and so a new value is added instead of keeping both.

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Create a sprint
# Create an issue and add it to the sprint
# Close the sprint and move open issues to backlog
# Open the issue created on step 2 and try editing sprint field
#* You won't be able to remove sprint created on step 1 however you'll be able to add a new sprint
# Run a search that returns that issue, then choose _Tools_ > _Bulk Change_ > Select the issue
# Choose _Edit_ option then enter a new value for sprint field
# Open the issue created on step 2, there'll see the sprint created on step 1 is no longer shown on sprint field
# The same happen while using the *Bulk Move* operation to a different project filtered by the same board.

h3. Expected Results
Issue should keep closed sprint information

h3. Actual Results
The value of sprint field is replaced

h3. Workarounds
-
fields.summary: Bulk edit of Sprint field and Bulk Move will remove issues from closed sprints

fields.description:
With all of the Backlog, Epic, and Version management coming to the Kanban boards, I'd like to throw in consideration for a new report.

For Kanban teams that are using Story Point estimation, there isn't a great way to get a general sense of Velocity without custom queries and manually adding things up.  There also isn't a great way to see the impact of Story Points size to actual effect on your cycle time (e.g. a "1" might take 3d, and "5" might take 2w).

These two things would be very helpful:
- A new Velocity Segmentation report where we can look across the history of the done work in the project and hone in on specific timeframes, with Story Points adding up on the fly.  I could see this being part of either the Control Chart or Cumulative Flow very easily (Flow makes more sense). 
-- Very few Kanban teams enjoy consistent and similar sized work to lean exclusively on a Control Chart.  Velocity in conjunction with the Control Chart helps get a better understanding of flow.
- Matrix of Story Point values as filters in the Control Chart by default (no need to make quick filters for them)
fields.summary: Story Point and Velocity Segmentation for Kanban

fields.description:
For those of us who are still running JIRA Agile on Server version < 7.0, it is extremely frustrating not to have documentation for both the basic REST API and the agile (Greenhopper) REST API. For example, on our server, this GET command works:

<server>/rest/greenhopper/1.0/project

but unexpectedly this does not

<server>/rest/greenhopper/1.0/sprint

The currently available agile REST API documentation (https://docs.atlassian.com/greenhopper/REST/cloud/) is no help. It says that this call should work:

GET /rest/agile/1.0/board

but neither it (results in 404 error) nor any guessed-at variation of this call works on our server. For example, the call <server>/rest/greenhopper/1.0/board results in:

<status>
<status-code>404</status-code>
<message>
null for uri: http://jira.roguewave.com/rest/greenhopper/1.0/board
</message>
</status>

Could you take pity on us and post the api and greenhopper documentation for server 6.x somewhere? I know your preferred solution would be for us to upgrade to the current JIRA version, but developers do not always have control of such things, which upper managers see more in terms of time/effort/cost.

Many thanks for whatever help you can give.
fields.summary: JIRA Greenhopper REST documentation not available

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Sprints can now be affected by complex filters on the origin board if the filter is too complex. The manage sprints permission introduces the "origin board concept for sprint". If the filter query for a sprint is complex (several clauses) it requires the filter either be simplified or the user must have the manage sprints permission for all projects in the instance not just associated projects with the filter. This can cause problems managing a sprint if it exist in several boards as there isn't an easy way via the UI to identify origin board the sprint was created on to resolve the issue. 

See blog post [Updates on the planned second release of sprint management permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/blog/2016/02/updates-on-the-planned-second-release-of-sprint-management-permission] and  [Sprints shared between multiple boards|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Sprints+shared+between+multiple+boards] for reference. 

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Provide a UI method that will show the origin board of sprint to resolve the complex query issue. 

h3. Workaround 

- *Cloud users:*
Please contact support.atlassian.com
- *Server users:*
Please contact your Database administrator for  your JIRA DB to execute the following query to find the origin board for a sprint:
{code:sql}
select b."ID", b."NAME" as board_name, s."NAME" as sprint_Name from "AO_60DB71_SPRINT" s, "AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW" b where s."NAME" = '<SprintName>' and s."RAPID_VIEW_ID" = b."ID";
{code}
*The above SQL was written for Postgres. Syntax for the query may need to be adjusted for your DB engine.*
fields.summary: Provide UI method to identify origin board for a sprint.
